content.description: Short, hard crux to slabby knobs.
content.protection: 4 quickdraws, rivet hanger and nut for hangerless 1/4" bolt
content.location: To the right of the Alimony Cracks and left of the Guide Cracks.

content.description: Fun, but runout for leader and follower. Climb up a ramp, crux, to the 1st bolt. Then traverse left to the 2nd bolt and straight up 15-20ft to the 3rd bolt up some knobs to the anchor.
content.location: To the right of Alimony Cracks and left of the Guide Cracks.

content.description: Clip the first two bolts of Hogwash, then go left.  The crux is well-protected, after the third bolt, very glassy.  The type of moves where your shoes will squeak as they try to stick! Keep trending left to intersect in the second pitch of Great Circle.  Reid and Falkenstein have this route rated PG/R, but I found it PG.
content.protection: 8 bolts to anchors, rap with 2 ropes.  First two bolts shared with Hogwash, last two bolts shared with Great Circle.

content.description: From the top of a small flake, right of "Great Circle", climb past 7 bolts to the "Great Circle" anchors. Rappel 150'.

content.location: Center of South Flank. Third crack from the left. Ten feet right of the pillar. Begins at flaring pockets.

content.description: The rightmost and easiest of the Guide Cracks.  Fun easy and well protected crack/pod climbing.  A great  introduction to trad leading and crack climbing.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Bolted anchor with chains.  Shares anchor with 5.7 guide crack to the left.

content.description:
The second crack from the left of the guide cracks. Climb the hand and finger crack to a rest ~20ft. off the deck.  Then climb the right facing dihedral until you can move onto the slab and bolted anchors.

Using only the crack makes this climb a bit harder.  The moves are easy with technique but the many knobs in the crack are not too kind to the feet.  For those who wish there're ways to bypass sections of the upper and lower cracks.
content.protection: Standard rack.  2 bolt anchor or optional .5"- 4" gear anchor in the crack.
content.location: 2nd Guide Crack from the left. Just right of the pillar.

content.description: This is the left most line of the Guide Cracks.  Ascend a left facing dihedral to the the top of the pillar.  Head up the  crack until you can move right onto the slab and bolted anchor.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Anchor consists of two good bolts with chains. Optional old third bolt could be used for directional.

content.description:
This route is left of the center of the cliff and starts in a crack on the left side of a polished gold slab.

Climb the crack, move up past two bolts (5.9), to a three bolt belay.

Climb through polish past two bolts to a two bolt anchor. Rappel 165'.
content.location: For more complete information, get "Rock Climbing Tuolumne Meadows" by Don Reid and Chris Falkenstein.

climbs.name: Fingertips
climbs.fa: Bruce Morris, Bill Taylor, Tom Judson, 8/1973.

content.description:
Climb past 2 bolts, then move right past two more and up a flake to a two bolt belay.

A 5.10a pitch moves left and up past two bolts then right past another bolt, then up to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: For more complete information, get "Rock Climbing Tuolumne Meadows" by Don Reid and Chris Falkenstein.

content.description:
Really fun route, great for a first "wide" lead. Climb the rightmost, wide, alimony crack.

Don't be intimidated by the appearance of the start, it's not as burly as it looks and it's more fun than the crack on the left. The first wide pod goes without any real offwidth moves.

Higher you will find opportunity for some true offwidth moves, though my partner managed to climb it with only a cowboy arete move and some shoulder jamming...

Save at least half your wide gear for the top. I found the Crux to be the wide section at the top, while my (shorter) partner found exiting the lower wide pod to be the crux.
content.protection:
Doubles 1" to 4"

An optional 5" and/or 6" piece should stitch it up if you don't want to run out at the top.

Two rappels from the bolts at the top will get you down.

content.description:
Climb the left of two parallel cracks at the left side of the cliff.  The crux is pulling through a short, steep section (5.8).  Beyond this, easy climbing leads to a bolted rap anchor.

Two raps with a single 60m rope will get you back to the ground.  The second rap is a full 100', so be careful.  You can also TR

Fingertips

from the lower anchor.
content.location:
The parallel cracks just right and uphill from

Fingertips

at the left end of the cliff.

climbs.name: 14 Karat
climbs.fa: Scott Cole, Bruce Morris, Chris Cantwell.

content.description:
This is one of the first climbs encountered upon arrival at the cliff.

Same start as "Fingertips". Climb up to the first bolt, move up and left past 3 more bolts to a 2 bolt belay. The crux is shortly before the belay.

Climb a 5.10a pitch past 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor.

Either walk off left or rappel 165'.
